project.teaser: Di-Hydro contributes towards harnessing the full potential of hydro-power (HP) plants and clusters in line with the objectives of the European Green Deal and the Paris Agreement, by development of tailored, optimized digital and smart decision-making tools for use in such...
project.objective: Di-Hydro contributes towards harnessing the full potential of hydro-power (HP) plants and clusters in line with the objectives of the European Green Deal and the Paris Agreement, by development of tailored, optimized digital and smart decision-making tools for use in such plants, at scale. Indeed, Di-Hydro will develop smart devices and pro-active intelligent algorithms that utilize data acquired from static, dynamic, and alternative sources (e.g., satellites) so as to predict the operational and maintenance-related behavior of standalone HP plants and clusters, and we will then incorporate such algorithms in digital twins that can fully interrelate with such HP plants/clusters, yielding, eventually, an intelligent, fully-replicable decision-making tool for optimal coordination of environmentally mindful power generation from such plants/clusters (based on the foreseen market needs and the intended commercial strategy of their owners). Notably, a wide variety of previous plant digitization levels, weather and water flow conditions, biodiversity, environmental and societal issues pertinent to such HP clusters are incorporated in the integrated practical solution developed here, mainly by leveraging innovative sensor technologies, cutting-edge digital adaption for energy production, and optimized operation and maintenance practices based on next-gen information technology. The consortium is comprised of 13 partners, 3 of which are RTOs, 7 SMEs, and 3 large power enterprises (represented here by their hydro-power branches).
project.title: DIGITAL MAINTENANCE FOR SUSTAINABLE AND FLEXIBLE OPERATION OF HYDROPOWER PLANT
project.keywords: Hydropower plant, operation and maintenance, digital, sensors, monitoring, environmental and socio-economic sustainability

article.title: A boost for hydro-power’s green potential

result.title: Project, data management and risk plan
result.description: Project organization in terms of team structure, roles, responsibilities and work plan. It describes the Quality Assurance procedure and the strategy to keep risks under control and mitigate them. Analysis of the main elements of the data management policy that will be used by the project partners.(revised M17 and M35)

result.title: Social, Ethical, Legal, Privacy issues identification and monitoring
result.description: Identification, definition and description of the guidelines for the project and the required documentations, including possible social, ethical, legal and privacy issues(updated M36)

result.title: Digital transformation of the HP sector
result.description: Report on current digital status of HPPs and clusters in the EU. This will be based on data obtained from involved HPPs and companies, which will be processed for extracting interdependencies among machinery/infrastructure status of HPPs and clusters, operational parameters and interconnectivity, O&M protocols, weather and external conditions, digitization level, data security, energy market and econo-societal needs, water quality and environmental effects.

result.title: Requirements, Tools & Definitions
result.description: Report on requirements and specifications for full digitization of HP sector. Based on participating HPPs and utilizing data obtained in D1.1, sets the goals of fully digital O&M system for modern digitally handled HPP and clusters, investigating pathways and tools to reach it in accordance with existing level of digitization. Requirements for data security and interoperability and for developing the decision-making platform. Definition of use cases and adoption in further HPPs and clusters.

result.title: Di-Hydro project website
result.description: A project website including private and public areas will be opened. It will provide information regarding research outcomes, data, AI-based algorithms, social adoption of digital technologies in HPPs, environmental reports and will enable communication between relevant shareholders and the general public. Private full access to data, technologies and early outcomes to consortium members.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
